concept.title: User and Group for Service Start
concept.shortdesc: When you run as a service, runs as the system user account and group defined in environment variables. The default system user and group are named sdc.

conbody.p: SDC_USERenvironment variableSDC_GROUPenvironment variableenvironment variablessystem userenvironment variablessystem groupYou must create a system user and group named sdc, or you must edit the values of the environment variables to point to an existing system user or group.

The file that you edit to define the user and group environment variable depends on your operating system:
Operating systems that use the SysV init system For , edit the $SDC_DIST/libexec/sdcd-env.sh file which includes the following user and group environment variables:
SDC_USER - Defines the system user used to run as a service. Default is sdc.
SDC_GROUP - Defines the system group used to run as a service. Default is sdc.
Operating systems that use the systemd init system For , edit the $SDC_DIST/systemd/sdc.service file which includes the following user and group environment variables:
User - Defines the system user used to run as a service. Default is sdc.
Group - Defines the system group used to run as a service. Default is sdc.
conbody.note: When you run manually, runs as the system user account logged into the command prompt when the launch command is run. To run as another user account, see .
